errorCategory.title: tts:origin not significant (TTML1)
errorCategory.shortUserDesc:
The attribute tts:origin has only significance on the following
                elements: tt:region (or on a tt:set child of it), tt:style.
errorCategory.longUserDesc:
A style property has only effect on the rendered content if one or
                more of the following cases are true: It is specified on an element where it
                applies. It can be inherited to an element where it applies. It is specified on a
                tt:set element which is the child of a content element where it
                applies.

specs.name: Timed Text Markup Language 1 (TTML1) (Second Edition), Version 2013-09-24
specs.text: Applies to: region

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0 (IMSC1), Version 2016-04-21
specs.text:
A Document Instance that conforms to a profile defined herein: SHALL satisfy
                all normative provisions specified by the profile; MAY include any vocabulary,
                syntax or attribute value associated with a Feature or Extension whose disposition
                is permitted in the profile; SHALL NOT include any vocabulary, syntax or attribute
                value associated with a Feature or Extension whose disposition is prohibited in the
                profile.

specs.name:
TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0 (IMSC1) - Text
                Profile, Version 2016-04-21
specs.text:
The Text Profile consists of Sections 6. Common Constraints and 7. Text
                Profile Constraints.

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0.1 (IMSC1), Version 2017-07-13
specs.text:
A Document Instance that conforms to a profile defined herein: SHALL satisfy
                all normative provisions specified by the profile; MAY include any vocabulary,
                syntax or attribute value associated with a Feature or Extension whose disposition
                is permitted or optional in the profile; SHALL NOT include any vocabulary, syntax or
                attribute value associated with a Feature or Extension whose disposition is
                prohibited in the profile.

specs.name:
TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0.1 (IMSC1) - Text
                Profile, Version 2017-07-13
specs.text:
The Text Profile consists of Sections 6. Common Constraints and 7. Text
                Profile Constraints.

specs.name: Netflix: Timed Text Style Guide: General Requirements, Version 2016-11-16
specs.text:
Subtitle and SDH files for all languages must be delivered in a TTML (.dfxp or
                .xml) format, except for Japanese, which must be delivered in Videotron Lambda Cap
                format.

errorCategory.title: Same timecode syntax
errorCategory.shortUserDesc:
All timecodes in a document should use the same syntax, either
                clock-time or offset-time.
errorCategory.longUserDesc:
It is good practice to use the same syntax for all timecodes in a
                document, as it ensures consistent behaviour for subsequent processing for all
                timecodes in the document.

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0 (IMSC1), Version 2016-04-21
specs.text:
[The feature] #timing [is] permitted [and has the] additional provision
                    "All time expressions within a Document Instance SHOULD use the same syntax,
                    either clock-time or offset-time.".

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0.1 (IMSC1), Version 2017-07-13
specs.text:
[The feature] #timing [is] permitted [and has the] additional provision
                    "All time expressions within a Document Instance SHOULD use the same syntax,
                    either clock-time or offset-time.".

errorCategory.title: ttp:dropMode not allowed
errorCategory.shortUserDesc:
The attribute ttp:dropMode shall not be
                present.
errorCategory.longUserDesc:
While this attribute affects only the 'smpte' timebase, some
                text-based profiles like IMSC1 only allow the 'media' timebase, as this timeline is
                usually used for Internet distribution. Thus this attribute would have no meaning,
                if present.

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0 (IMSC1), Version 2016-04-21
specs.text: [The feature] #dropMode [is] prohibited.

specs.text: [The feature] #dropMode [is] prohibited.

errorCategory.title: Only 'media' allowed for ttp:timeBase
errorCategory.shortUserDesc:
For the attribute ttp:timeBase only the value "media" is
                permitted.
errorCategory.longUserDesc:
TTML1 specifies three possible timebase values: media, smpte and
                clock. In some text-based profiles like IMSC1, the usage of timebase 'smpte' and
                'clock' is not permitted. The default timebase is 'media' if ttp:timeBase is not
                specified on the tt element.

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0 (IMSC1), Version 2016-04-21
specs.text:
[The features] #timeBase-clock [and] #timeBase-smpte [are]
                    prohibited.

specs.text:
[The features] #timeBase-clock [and] #timeBase-smpte [are]
                    prohibited.

errorCategory.title: Minimum frame gap
errorCategory.shortUserDesc:
The gap between two adjacent subtitles must be at least two
                frames.
errorCategory.longUserDesc:
There has to be a reasonable amount of gap between two adjacent
                subtitles where no subtitle is displayed.

specs.name: Netflix: Timed Text Style Guide: General Requirements, Version 2016-11-16
specs.text: 2 frames minimum (regardless of frame rate)

messages.messageMain:
Assertion: The gap between two adjacent subtitles is at least two frames.
                Error Information: The gap between the current and the following subtitle is 0 frame(s) given a frame rate of 50 fps.
messages.messageAssertion: The gap between two adjacent subtitles is at least two frames.
messages.messageDiagnosticsAll: The gap between the current and the following subtitle is 0 frame(s) given a frame rate of 50 fps.

errorCategory.title: No inline animation
errorCategory.shortUserDesc:
The attributes tts:disparity, tts:extent, tts:origin and
                tts:position shall not be present on any of the following elements: tt:div,
                tt:p.
errorCategory.longUserDesc:
IMSC 1.1 does not allow inline animations using implied regions.
                Such regions are defined by specifying any of the mentioned attributes on a block
                content element.

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.1, Version 2017-10-17

                    specified]
